shows.title: Investigating Diana's Death / The Future of Humanity
shows.first_half: First Half: August 31 marked 28 years since the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, who died in a car crash in Paris. Was there more to what happened that evening than what we were told? Author and investigative reporter Steve Ubaney will share his research and new evidence he's uncovered.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and screenwriter Jason Diamond will explain the workings of our universe in a unique yet relatable way. He'll also explore the future of humanity—what could happen if we continue the way we're going—by reflecting on each individual's contribution to society.

shows.title: Protecting Family Farms / Paranormal Encounters
shows.first_half: First Half: Rural policy expert Brian Reisinger will explain how the disappearance of family farms has left our food supply vulnerable, and why he believes most food has become too expensive and unhealthy. He feels America is on pace to lose the rest of its farms in just 40 years.
shows.second_half: Second Half: At the age of 8, John Olsen began to realize that the home he lived in was a hotbed of strange experiences, such as phantom knocks, loud footsteps running up the stairs, and missing objects. He'll talk about growing up in that home and share the strange experiences of people he's interviewed.

shows.title: Natural Health Remedies / Tarot's Many Uses
shows.first_half: First Half: Pharmacist Ben Fuchs will discuss natural health remedies and the vitamins, nutrients, and minerals that our bodies need to maintain good health.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author, Tarot expert, and award-winning Tarot deck creator Sasha Graham will discuss how the cards work, where they come from, and why Tarot has such an active hold on the world’s imagination. She'll talk about the variety of ways in which Tarot can be used, from spell work to writing and even psychotherapy. Graham will also explain how Tarot has exploded in the age of social media.

shows.title: Computing Reality / Contact in the Chihuahuan Desert
shows.first_half: First Half: Scientist Samuel Arbesman will discuss computing, not as a branch of engineering, but as a humanistic liberal art connected to how we understand reality. He'll talk about how computers strongly influence our fears and desires, and why he thinks code is in many ways sorcery made real.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Gemologist Leela Hutchison will share insights from over twenty years of research, beginning with her role on the first exploration team to enter the deadly Selenite Crystal Caves of Mexico in 2001. She will also discuss the many accounts of high strangeness linked to the region, including UFO crash retrievals and other enduring mysteries of the Chihuahuan Desert connected to the Giant Crystals of northern Mexico.

shows.title: 9/11 Investigation / Ghosts of the Battlefield
shows.first_half: First Half: On the 24th anniversary of 9/11, architect Richard Gage will discuss the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center. Gage is a founding member of Architects and Engineers for 9/11 Truth, and he maintains the buildings came down in the exact manner of a controlled demolition.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Paranormal Investigator Adrian Lee has investigated ghostly activity all over the world for over 25 years. He'll discuss the battlefield ghosts of Native American warriors and US soldiers, and the restless souls at some of the most haunted historic places in the world.

shows.title: The Metaphysics of Reincarnation / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author Seann Aswell joins guest host Richard Syrett to discuss the metaphysics of reincarnation, and how life's path is shaped by synchronicity rather than planning. He'll share his 15 years of research on past lives, including his trips to places he believes he has lived before. Aswell claims previous life experiences shape our present reality, and that we are all spiritual beings having a human experience. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half—give Richard a call and discuss whatever's on your mind!
